item.title: Flock2018
item.description: WOW! What an experience it was to meet all the people I have been knowing through IRC..faceless people with random nick that has nothing to do with their name.. but brilliant minds who make a very open, inclusive, welcoming and a powerful project possible! This was my first Flock and It has been the best conference/event I have ever attended. Unlike other conferences where there are a lot of people presenting their own project and are distributed in groups, everyone in the Flock was connected to a single string, Fedora!

item.title: websiteInfo
item.description: Let’s discuss vsiddhar.me I have been suggested multiple time to manage a blog, share my stories, events and ideas, but as being a ‘Pro’ procrastinator, I haven’t run from my responsibilities and thus, haven’t done the right thing! Sadly, this changes now. I have decided to manage this colorless website (Hugo+Coder, as it requires ~no effort). If I am alive and in right sense, I will be putting at least one post every week month.

item.title: Learn Markdown
item.description: Style Demo # h1 Heading h1 Heading ## h2 Heading h2 Heading ### h3 Heading h3 Heading #### h4 Heading h4 Heading ##### h5 Heading h5 Heading ###### h6 Heading h6 Heading **This is bold text** This is bold text __This is bold text__ This is bold text *This is italic text* This is italic text _This is italic text_ This is italic text ~~Deleted text~~ Deleted text > Block quotes are > written like so.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in go templates. This document is a brief primer on using go templates.

item.title: /me is
item.description: Contributor && Ambassador @ Fedora Project FOSS enthusiast, evangelist Self declared developer and command line hero Working @ Fedora | Red Hat Contact & Social Network accounts IRC Nick: irc.freenode.net: siddharthvipul irc.devel.redhat.com: siddharthvipul Lurk-around channels: #centos-devel, #fedora, #fedora-devel, #fedora-india, #fedora-qa Telegram: siddharthvipul Email: siddharthvipul1 [at] gmail.com (personal) vipul@redhat.com (work) Country: India Region: Bengaluru (follows UTC + 5:30) Languages: English, Hindi FAS Account: siddharthvipul1 Social networks: Twitter: siddharthvipul GitHub: siddharthvipul LinkedIn: siddharthvipul Facebook: siddharthvipul Tools of Choice Editor: vim!
